Key Match Events: India’s captain Suryakumar Yadav hit a four off the first ball of the Super Over bowled by Maheesh Theekshana.
Off-spinner Washington Sundar took two wickets in the opening four balls of the Super Over as India beat Sri Lanka in the third T20 to sweep the three-match series 3-0.
India scored 137-9 after losing the toss and batting first.
Sri Lanka made a good start, scoring 110-1 in 15.1 overs, but collapsed from 117-2 to 137-8.
India’s Rinku Singh and Yadav picked up four wickets for eight runs in their two overs of spin.
Pre-Game Insights: Rain had delayed the start of the game.
With the series already settled, Sri Lanka made two changes and India four, with the fit-again Shubman Gill returning and both Hardik Pandya and Rishabh Pant rested.
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav said, 'Recovering from 30-4, I thought 140 was a par score on that wicket. The boys showed character and I told them, if we showed heart, we could pull it off.'
Washington Sundar was named player of the match.
Yadav, in his first outing as India’s new T20 skipper, was named player of the series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain had delayed the start of the game.
India had already taken an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. It won the first T20 by 43 runs and the second match by seven wickets.
